content.header: Find the six clues on the painting.

hotspots.hotspot: The white uniforms show that the European soldiers are civilized and heroic.
This brave European soldier is wounded but trying to reload.
The brave European general rallies his troops.
The uncivilized Africans wear no regimental uniforms.
The Africans are disorganized and fight with traditional weapons, such as spears and shields.
The Europeans fight with precision weapons, such as rifles and cannons.

scene.credits: (tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (c)Mary Evans Picture Library/Alamy, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

content.header: Find the six clues on the painting.

hotspots.hotspot: The Africans advance bravely upon the Europeans.
The Africans use modern cannons and machine guns as weapons.
The African emperor rallies his troops to victory.
Religious leaders pray for the African soldiers.
Saint George, a Christian saint, spiritually protects the African troops.
The European commander turns his horse away to retreat from battle.

scene.credits: (tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (c)Archives Charmet/The Bridgeman Art Library, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.
(tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (t)Mary Evans Picture Library/Alamy, (b)Archives Charmet/The Bridgeman Art Library, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

multiple.question: How do you suppose most Europeans viewed the Italian soldiers in the first painting?

multiple.question: How do you suppose Ethiopians viewed the Italian soldiers in the second painting?

multiple.question: Even without knowing the historical context of the painting, how do you know it is propaganda?

answers.answer: It shows the hardships of war.
It appeals to a viewer's sense of patriotism.
It makes Napoleon appear uncertain and tentative.

scene.credits: (tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (inset)Peter Willi/The Bridgeman Art Library, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

multiple.question: How is movement suggested in this painting?

answers.answer: by the color and texture of the rocky trail
by the contrast of light and dark found in shadows
by Napoleon's cloak and the horse's tail and mane

scene.credits: (tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (inset)Peter Willi/The Bridgeman Art Library, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

multiple.question: Visuals are a form of communication.
"Subject matter" includes what you think or feel after looking at a visual.
Historical paintings often reflect the artist's point of view.
"Historical context" means studying a visual in regard to what was happening at the time the visual was created.
Successful visuals are only those that you like.
"Visual elements" include shapes, lines, textures, colors, and symbols.
The Taj Mahal is located in China.
Hindu art utilizes only geometric shapes and calligraphy.
Visuals with a persuasive purpose are propaganda.
Symmetry in art refers to its texture.

scene.credits: (tr)Tetra Images/Getty Images, (bkgd)Kathy Collins/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.
